data.title: Atom does not open file when a file is clicked in the side bar
data.body:
I am using atom version 0.188 on OS X. I have loaded all my project files in atom editor. All the files tend to appear in the sidebar just fine but when i double click on a file, the file opens in the same tab, and the files tab name is not updated, although the atom bar on the top does update the name. 

So i can open multiple files in atom editor. Is this a bug because i really want to use atom but this is really irritating.

Thanks

data.title: autosave should not have two ways to enable/disable
data.body:
As each package has an enable/disable option through the settings view, a package should not have its own enable/disable setting, as a package should never have to check for itself if it is enabled or not.

If autosave is not something that should be enabled by default (which I feel it isn't), it probably shouldn't even be installed by default in the first place.

Small cleanups like these could probably help make Atom faster. Even though it's only 2ms in this case, all bits help (especially because the Atom startup time, on my desktop, is currently around 7 seconds).

![autosave](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1885159/6902810/73342578-d716-11e4-815e-7e316b4d49f6.png)

ghc-modi is installed and is in the current path.

data.title: Selecting text in atom based text editor doesn't work like native platform
data.body:
In particular on Mac OS X if you:
1. start creating a drag selection.
2. Drag to above the text editor.
3. Then the text selection will always extend to the 0 column of the text.

But in Atom this doesn't happen. Instead the selection extends to the column based on the mouse x position, even when the mouse y position is above the text editor. (Atom does correctly handle the case (set selection to end of text) when the mouse extends below the text editor... it's only the above case that's not working correctly).

This pull request fixes the issue:

https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6167

data.title: Fix screenPositionForPixelPosition for case above first row.
data.body:
Currently screenPositionForPixelPosition special cases pixel positions
below the last row so that the column position is always set to the
last column of the last line, even if the pixel 'x' position is less
then that column.

This patch special cases picks above the first row so that the  text
column position will be in the first column even if the pixel 'x'
position is greater then that column.

At a higher level, this patch fixes the problem where you can’t select
to the start of a text field by just clicking and dragging up. Instead
you have to click and drag back (x axis) beyond the start of the text
field.

Closes #6168

data.title: Atom doesn't want to update
data.body:
I'm on windows 8.1, using Atom 0.186.0 currently.
I'm trying to update but it doesn't want to.

When Atom starts, it tries to update, then nothing. And when I click `Help > Check for update` it says me that 0.186.0 is the last version.

I tried to empty the `package`folder which was containing only one file (`atom-0.188.0-full.nupkg`) in case it was corrupted or something, but nothing changed.

Here is the `SquirrelUpdate.log` file content:

data.title: Move from CoffeeScript to ES6+
data.body: There are some disadvantages of using CoffeeScript when writing stuff (better described [here](https://discuss.bevry.me/t/move-from-coffeescript-to-es6/30)). Till Atom cares of performance and contributions (JS is definitely more popular and widely known language than CoffeeScript) switch to ES6+ looks fair enough and future-proof. Also Atom already uses io.js which supports some ES6 features too. So using let/const, typed arrays and other features should improve performance

data.title: Support `block` as a decoration type for TextEditor.
data.body: There should be a `block` decoration type that can span the entire width of the editor, appearing below a line and forcing subsequent lines to appear below it. This could be used to display UI for things like inline comments, as you can in a GitHub pull request.

data.title: Ability to import multiple snippets.cson files
data.body:
**Feature**

Ability to do an `@import` or `require()` syntax for breaking up snippets into multiple files. For example `@import "/snippets/documentation-snippets.cson"` or `require('snippets/javascript-snippets.cson')`.

**Why**

After awhile, snippet files can become pretty overwhelming to manage. Having multiple files would not only help with organization, but make it a little easier to manage changes to certain snippets.

**Example**

Given a file called `snippets/javascript-snippets.cson` with contents like:

```
###
  JavaScript Snippets
###
'.source.js':
  'Console log':
    'prefix': 'log'
    'body': "console.log($1);"
```

We could import it lnto `~/.atom/snippets.cson` like:

```
# Your snippets
#
# Atom snippets allow you to enter a simple prefix in the editor and hit tab to
# expand the prefix into a larger code block with templated values.
#
# You can create a new snippet in this file by typing "snip" and then hitting
# tab.
#
# An example CoffeeScript snippet to expand log to console.log:
#
# '.source.coffee':
#   'Console log':
#     'prefix': 'log'
#     'body': "console.log $1'"
#

# Syntax #1
@import "snippets/javascript-snippets.cson";

# Syntax #2
require('snippets/javascript-snippets.cson');
```

This annoying problem has been come up for a very long time.

I have tried all these and the problem is the same
- from first beta release till now 0.188.0
- from OS X 10.8.4 through 10.9 till now 10.10.2
- using --safe mode
- try different theme
- try different font families / sizes / line-heights

The problem is only found in editor, it can not reproduced in any other interface, etc. settings tab

I am very confusing if I could diagnose on this problem by any other way?

data.title: Automatically install package updates option
data.body: Could there be an option to automatically install package updates? When I see package updates, I usually just install them blindly, so I would like to have it just keep everything up to date for me. It would also be nice if there could be a notification when it updates something.

data.title: File Search Result Order Is Unintuitive
data.body:
When searching for a file with `CMD + P` I would expect results with exact filenames to be more relevant.

![screen shot 2015-03-28 at 10 39 12 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1388079/6882075/bbb89860-d536-11e4-83b6-57ee45aa76f0.png)

data.title: Find in Project result count out of sync with hits displayed
data.body:
How to reproduce:
- Search for something with `Find in Project` wait until search is done.
- Go into one file that has a hit, remove the line that had the hit.
- Result count should now correctly go -1, while the entry should be removed from the search page.
- Re add the line, in the same file or another file.
- Result count should now correctly go +1 back to the original count (_nice!_), but the entry is _not_ added to the search page (_sad!_).

I think the best options here would be
- (**sub optimal**) To not make the result count go +1.
- (**optimal**) Keep the result count go +1 and add the new result to the search page without having to do a new search. 

Added screenshot showing 3 results in count, but only showing two.
![screen shot 2015-03-28 at 18 23 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1426157/6882023/c2daed5a-d577-11e4-82de-3b0c9daf0c4e.png)

data.title: window size & pos not saved portable in ATOM_HOME/.atom
